intro: Steffensia adunca var. glabrata, commonly known as the smoothleaf steffensia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves that are smooth and glabrous. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, which bloom during the warmer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand periods of drought. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
